diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Diverticulosis of intestine, part unspecified, without perforation or abscess without bleeding
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with abdominal pain, melena, fevers, and chills. Imaging revealed a dilated, fluid-filled, and hyperemic appendix with surrounding fat stranding, consistent with acute appendicitis, while also noting diverticulosis which was ruled out as the primary source of symptoms.
